Clock Configuration

Files

file  pmhal_clocktree.h
 This file contains Acyclic Graph Abstract Data Type, it has the graph node API for tree traversal.
 
file  pmhal_cm.h
 This file contains the prototypes of the APIs present in the device abstraction layer file of PRCM Clock mode. This also contains some related macros.
 
file  pmhal_sd.h
 This file contains the prototypes of the APIs present in the device abstraction layer file of Static Dependency Mangager.
 
file  pmhal_videopll.h
 This file contains enumeration declarations for different elements of videopll. This is only for tda2xx.

int32_t PMHALCMDpllConfigure (pmhalPrcmNodeId_t dpllId, const pmhalPrcmDpllConfig_t *pDpllData, uint32_t timeOut)
 This API configures different parameters of PLL as indicated by the input. If the multiplier and divider are updated it also makes sure the PLL is locked with new values.The post divider is also considered as part of PLL. This API can be used to configure the PLL with initial values and also to change the frequency during OPP change (DVFS). More...
 
int32_t PMHALCMDpllDividerSet (pmhalPrcmNodeId_t dpllId, uint32_t dividerValue)
 This API sets the divide (DPLL N) value of a divider. The hardware divides by (N+1) internally. Value of N should be provided by this API. At reset the divider value will be set to the reset value. If the application need to set a different divider this API shall be called. More...

Detailed Description

The Clock Domain Manager (CM) is a component of the Power Management (PM) software which provides access to the PRCM database to enable/disable the clock domains and provides APIs to program the dividers DPLL and multiplexers

Clock domain API would not take care of the elements in the path which source clock from the given DPLL when the DPLL frequency is changed. USER / APP needs to monitor the same and make changes accordingly.

The Clock Rate Configuration APIs are used to configure the module clocks to run at desired clock frequency as specified by the user.
The generic clocking scheme in the device can be visualized as a tree where a certain input clock to the device is the root node (or Root Clock) of the clock tree and the modules are leaf nodes. Between these two levels are multiple levels consisting of DPLLs, multiplexers, dividers etc.
Configuring a clock frequency for the module requires programming these DPLLs, multiplexers and dividers.

  • The Clock Rate Configuration APIs abstracts the programming of various PRCM clocking elements, such as DPLL, dividers and multiplexers, to provide the desired frequency for the given module clock. It uses the PRCM Database and the clock frequency database to configure module clocks.

The Static Dependency (SD) HAL manager helps to enable or disable the software configurable static dependency between different clock domains.

Video-PLL library provides APIs configure the Video PLL to the required frequency for display application. Video-pll library calculates the values of multiplier, divider and post divider, these values selected may not be with least jitter. In case the frequency cannot be obtained from any combination the lib doesn’t approximate to nearest but returns an error status as values cannot be calculated.

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum pmhalNodeType

Clock-tree node types.

Enumerator
PMHAL_MIN 

Lower bound (inclusive)

PMHAL_DPLL 

Node Type for DPLL

PMHAL_MUX 

Node Type for Multiplexer

PMHAL_DIV 

Node Type for Divider

PMHAL_ROOT_CLK 

Node Type for Root Clocks

PMHAL_MAX 

Enum Upper bound

PMHAL_COUNT 

Enum Count

PMHAL_UNDEF 

Undefined value

enum pmhalVideopllHSD

Enum defining HS divider for video pll.

Enumerator
PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_HSD_INVALID 

HSD INVALID enum.

PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_HSD_MIN 

Min value of the enum. Can be used for validation.

PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_HSD_M4 

Value of the enum for HSDivider M4

PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_HSD_M6 

Value of the enum for HSDivider M6

PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_HSD_M7 

Value of the enum for HSDivider M7

PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_HSD_MAX 

Max value of the enum. Can be used for validation.

PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_HSD_M2 

Value of the enum for HSDivider M2

enum videopllVenc

Enum for the Venc's Caution: Do not change the enum values these are exact match of Bsp_PlatformVenc .

Enumerator
PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_VENC_LCD1 

LCD1 Venc.

PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_VENC_LCD2 

LCD2 Venc.

PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_VENC_LCD3 

LCD3 Venc

PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_VENC_HDMI 

HDMI PLL.

PMHAL_VIDEOPLL_VENC_MAX 

This should be last Enum.

int32_t PMHALCMDpllConfigure ( pmhalPrcmNodeId_t  dpllId,
const pmhalPrcmDpllConfig_t *  pDpllData,
uint32_t  timeOut 
)

This API configures different parameters of PLL as indicated by the input. If the multiplier and divider are updated it also makes sure the PLL is locked with new values.The post divider is also considered as part of PLL. This API can be used to configure the PLL with initial values and also to change the frequency during OPP change (DVFS).

Note: The PLL configuration will affect the clock supplied to the down stream nodes. The caller is expected to handle the down stream of nodes which will be affected by this change. Function ultimately locks the DPLL.

Parameters
dpllIdUnique ID of the PLL
*pDpllDataPRCM Configuration values. Refer enum pmhalPrcmDpllConfig_t for values.
timeOutWait time duration.
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the API failed to complete the desired functionality (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid clock domain id
int32_t PMHALCMDpllCoreSwitchSource ( pmhalPrcmNodeId_t  sourceId,
const pmhalPrcmDpllConfig_t *  pDpllData,
uint32_t  timeOut 
)

This API is applicable only for TDA3xx SR2.0. It allows changing the DPLL CORE input clock source at run time.

Parameters
sourceIdUnique ID of the DPLL CORE clock source. Valid values are PMHAL_PRCM_ROOT_CLK_SYS_CLKIN1 or PMHAL_PRCM_ROOT_CLK_SYS_CLKIN2.
pDpllDataNew PLL configuration based on the chosen input clock.
timeOutWait time duration.
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the API failed to complete the desired functionality (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid source Id
int32_t PMHALCMDpllDividerSet ( pmhalPrcmNodeId_t  dpllId,
uint32_t  dividerValue 
)

This API sets the divide (DPLL N) value of a divider. The hardware divides by (N+1) internally. Value of N should be provided by this API. At reset the divider value will be set to the reset value. If the application need to set a different divider this API shall be called.

Note: This change in the clock divider may affect the modules which derive clock from this dpll. The application is expected to ensure other modules are handled to accommodate this change.

Parameters
dpllIdUnique ID of the node.
dividerValuedivider value
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the API failed to complete the desired functionality (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid clock domain id
int32_t PMHALCMDpllGetAllPostDivStatus ( pmhalPrcmNodeId_t  dpllId,
pmhalPrcmPllPostDivValue_t *  divConfig 
)

This API returns all the divide value of a HSdivider node in the clock tree.

Parameters
dpllIdUnique ID of the PLL
divConfigStructure with divider name whose value is to get. Name of the divider should be mentioned in 'postDivId' field of the struct pmhalPrcmPllPostDivValue_t.

NOTE: This api returns post divider value in 'configValue' field of the struct pmhalPrcmPllPostDivValue_t.

Returns
returns the maximum number of post dividers present for the dpll

int32_t PMHALCMDpllSetDriftGuard ( pmhalPrcmNodeId_t  dpllId)

This API Sets the DPLL Drift guard.

This bit allows to enable or disable the automatic recalibration feature of the DPLL. The DPLL will automatically start a recalibration process upon assertion of the DPLL's RECAL flag if this bit is set

Parameters
dpllIdUnique ID of the PLL
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,

int32_t PMHALCMDpllSetRampLevel ( pmhalPrcmNodeId_t  dpllId,
pmhalPrcmDpllRampLevel_t  rampLevel 
)

This API Sets the desired DPLL ramp level .

The DPLL provides an output clock frequency ramping feature when switching from bypass clock to normal clock during lock and re-lock. The frequency ramping will happen in a maximum of 4 steps in frequency before the DPLL's frequency lock indicator is asserted. This register is used to enable/disable the DPLL ramping feature.

Parameters
dpllIdUnique ID of the PLL
rampLevelPRCM Configuration values. User can set the Ramp Level Refer enum pmhalPrcmDpllRampLevel_t for values.
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the API failed to complete the desired functionality (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid clock domain id
int32_t PMHALCMDpllSetRampRate ( pmhalPrcmNodeId_t  dpllId,
pmhalPrcmDpllRampRate_t  rampRate 
)

This API Sets the desired DPLL ramp rate.

Selects the time in terms of DPLL REFCLKs spent at each stage of the clock ramping process

Parameters
dpllIdUnique ID of the PLL
rampRatePRCM Configuration values. User can set the Ramp Rate Refer enum pmhalPrcmDpllRampRate_t for values.
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the API failed to complete the desired functionality (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid clock domain id

int32_t PMHALCMGetModuleAllClockState ( pmhalPrcmModuleId_t  moduleId,
pmhalPrcmClockActivityState_t *  clockState 
)

This API is used to find if the clocks to a given module are enabled or disabled. It takes an "or" of all the clock states to the given module and populates the clockState with 1 if any clock is running and 0 if all clocks are gated.

Parameters
moduleIdModule ID of the interested module.
clockStateValue updated based on clocks are enabled/disabled.
Returns
status Return value of the API.
  • PM_SUCCESS : If the clockState is populated correctly.
  • PM_BADARGS : If the clockState pointer is NULL or the module is not valid.

errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the API failed to complete the desired functionality (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid clock domain id

This API resets all the optional clock for given modules.

Parameters
moduleIdUnique ID of the module to be enabled

int32_t PMHALStaticDepDisable ( pmhalPrcmCdId_t  srcDom,
pmhalPrcmCdId_t  destDom 
)

Disable the static dependency from the master clock domain to the slave clock domain.

Parameters
srcDomUnique Clock domain ID of the master clock domain. Refer enum pmhalPrcmCdId_t for valid values.
destDomUnique clock domain ID of the slave clock domain. Refer enum pmhalPrcmCdId_t for valid values.
Returns
status Status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS - The API cleared the static dependency correctly.
  • PM_BADARGS - The master clock domain does not have a static dependency register or the slave clock domain does not have a bit in the static dependency register.
  • PM_FAIL - The API cleared the static dependency but dependency is not software controllable in the design due to which it can not really clear it.
int32_t PMHALStaticDepDisableAllSlaveDep ( pmhalPrcmCdId_t  masterClockDom)

Disable the static dependency from the master clock domain to all slave clock domains.

Parameters
masterClockDomUnique Clock domain ID of the master clock domain. Refer enum pmhalPrcmCdId_t for valid values.
Returns
status Status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS - The API cleared the static dependency correctly.
  • PM_BADARGS - The master clock domain does not have a static dependency register.
int32_t PMHALStaticDepDisableToAllMaster ( pmhalPrcmCdId_t  slaveClockDom,
pmhalPrcmCdId_t *  failMasterDom 
)

Disable the static dependency from the slave clock domain to all master clock domains. This API loops through all the clock domains and clears the bit corresponding slave. If the static dependency cannot be cleared the API returns with the Clock domain of the ID for which the API tried to clear the dependency but could not.

Parameters
slaveClockDomUnique Clock domain ID of the slave clock domain. Refer enum pmhalPrcmCdId_t for valid values.
failMasterDomUnique Clock domain ID of the failed master domain. Refer enum pmhalPrcmCdId_t for valid values.
Returns
status Status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS - The API cleared the static dependency correctly.
  • PM_BADARGS - The slave clock domain does not have a static dependency bit.
  • PM_FAIL - The clearing of the bit for a given master failed. The failMasterDom is populated with the master domain clock ID if PM_FAIL is returned only if a valid pointer is sent to the API.
int32_t PMHALStaticDepEnable ( pmhalPrcmCdId_t  srcDom,
pmhalPrcmCdId_t  destDom 
)

Enable the static dependency from the master clock domain to the slave clock domain.

Parameters
srcDomUnique Clock domain ID of the master clock domain. Refer enum pmhalPrcmCdId_t for valid values.
destDomUnique clock domain ID of the slave clock domain. Refer enum pmhalPrcmCdId_t for valid values.
Returns
status Status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS - The API set the static dependency correctly.
  • PM_BADARGS - The master clock domain does not have a static dependency register or the slave clock domain does not have a bit in the static dependency register.
  • PM_FAIL - The API set the static dependency but dependency is reserved or not software controllable in the design due to which it can not really set it.
int32_t PMHALStaticDepRead ( pmhalPrcmCdId_t  clockDom,
uint32_t *  regVal 
)

Read the static dependency for a given clock domain.

Parameters
clockDomUnique Clock domain ID of the master clock domain. Refer enum pmhalPrcmCdId_t for valid values.
regValThe read register is stored in the memory location pointed to by the pointer regVal. For exact bit field set use the shift values mentioned in pmhalStaticDepBitShift_t
Returns
status Status of the API. This can be the following values:
  • PM_SUCCESS - The API read the static dependency correctly.
  • PM_BADARGS - The master clock domain does not have a static dependency register or the regVal pointer is NULL.
int32_t PMHALVideopllConfigure ( pmhalPrcmNodeId_t  videopllId,
const pmhalVideopllConfig_t *  pVideopllData,
uint32_t  timeOut 
)

This API configures different parameters of PLL as indicated by the input. If the multiplier and divider are updated it also makes sure the PLL is locked with new values.The post divider is also considered as part of PLL. This API can be used to configure the PLL with initial values only.

Note: The PLL configuration will affect the clock supplied to the down stream nodes. The caller is expected to handle the down stream of nodes which will be affected by this change. Function ultimately locks the DPLL. This is only for tda2xx.

Parameters
videopllIdUnique ID of the PLL
*pVideopllDataVideo Configuration values. Refer enum pmhalVideopllConfig_t for values.
timeOutWait time duration.
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the API failed to complete the desired functionality (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid Video Pll id
int32_t PMHALVideopllConfigureMux ( pmhalPrcmVideopllDssClkSrcMuxId_t  muxId,
pmhalPrcmVideopllMuxSelectId_t  pParentNodeId

Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,

  • PM_BADARGS Invalid Video Pll id

int32_t PMHALVideopllSetDivider ( pmhalPrcmNodeId_t  videopllId,
uint32_t  divValue 
)

This API sets the divide (DPLL N) value of a divider. Value of N should be provided by this API. At reset the divider value will be set to the reset value. If the application need to set a different divider this API shall be called.

Note: This change in the clock divider may affect the modules which derive clock from this dpll. The application is expected to ensure other modules are handled to accommodate this change. This is only for tda2xx.

Parameters
videopllIdUnique ID of the node.
divValueDivider value
Returns
errorStatus Status of API call. Can be any of the following,
  • PM_SUCCESS Indicates the operation is success
  • PM_FAIL Indicates the API failed to complete the desired functionality (timeout)
  • PM_BADARGS Invalid Video Pll id
